page.title: 01A summary of Elton and area
page.content: The village of Elton lies in the extreme north-west of the survey area. The village lies along the A605 road between Peterborough and Oundle,and between that road and the River Nene. Elton Hall,the home of the Proby family for nearly four hundred years, together with its park lies to the south of the village.The river runs over a weir and lock where a now disused water-mill stands.The population of the village is a mixture of those working more or less directly in farming,those who travel to professional commercial and industrial work in nearby towns and a small group of well-to-do retired. Rolling country with mixed farming and woodland occupies the rest of our block.A by-pass road is planned to cut through this land to re-route the A605.
